metrics.title: Journey
metrics.0: Throughout my career, I have actively collaborated with various areas such as development, product, deployment, and business, understanding the needs of each stakeholder and contributing to the delivery of high-quality products.
metrics.1: My skills include test automation, software testing in various modalities, agile methodologies, test management, continuous integration, version control, accessibility, SEO, quality consulting, and mentoring.
metrics.2: I am constantly seeking to improve my knowledge and skills to offer innovative and efficient solutions to each project's challenges.

amigotech.description: Defining quality strategies in an integrated medical fintech ecosystem, working across three main products:

highlights.0: Web application for Medical Accounting: Client accounting portal and PJ information dashboard, with E2E automation using Playwright
highlights.1: Mobile App 'Amigo One': Smart medical records and accounting management, implementing mobile tests with Appium
highlights.2: ABU 'Amigo Pay': Payment system integrated with BaaS (Dock), ensuring quality in critical integrations
highlights.3: Strategic quality consulting for the entire ecosystem, structuring test cases, processes, and metrics

teamsix.description: Worked on the migration project of the NotreDame IntermÃ©dica/Hapvida portal to Liferay, focusing on accessibility:

highlights.0: Implementation of WCAG standards for digital accessibility
highlights.1: Optimization of contrast, hierarchy, and navigation for screen readers
highlights.2: Consulting on SEO and web performance (LCP, CLS)
highlights.3: Application of the CROP heuristic for better user experience

liferay.description: Development and maintenance of automation frameworks for Liferay DXP, focusing on quality and efficiency:

highlights.0: Leadership in automation initiatives with Poshi (Selenium)
highlights.1: Management and configuration of environments with Apache Ant and Docker
highlights.2: Monitoring CI/CD with Jenkins and TestRail
highlights.3: Technical mentoring and documentation of QA processes

quality.title: Software quality
quality.subtitle: Exploring the fundamental pillars to ensure software excellence

exercise.title: Let's practice?
exercise.subtitle: Test your QA skills by finding bugs in different scenarios

quality.success: Congratulations! You found the bug in
quality.difficulty: Having trouble? Maybe study a bit more about the topic?
quality.study: Feel free to contact me so we can discuss it!
quality.journey: Quality is not an act, it is a habit. Keep improving your skills and making a difference in the software development world!
quality.continue: How about continuing this journey together? I'm always available to share experiences and knowledge about QA.

0.title: Functional testing and automation
0.description: Test automation is essential to ensure continuous software quality, enabling fast and consistent testing.

keyPoints.1: Integration with CI/CD for fast feedback

1.title: Performance and scalability
1.description: Ensuring that the software not only works, but works well under different load and usage conditions.

2.title: Security and compliance
2.description: Security is a critical aspect of quality, protecting data and ensuring regulatory compliance.

0.title: Find the bug in the interface
0.description: One of the buttons has a data-testid inconsistent with the pattern.
0.hint: Look for the button-X pattern in data-testids and find the one that doesn't match.
0.explanation: In automated tests, selector consistency is crucial. Inconsistent data-testids can cause test failures and make maintenance harder.

1.title: Accessibility - Contrast
1.description: Which of these color combinations does NOT meet the minimum WCAG contrast criteria?
1.hint: WCAG requires a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text.
1.explanation: The combination of medium gray (#CBD5E0) on dark gray (#4A5568) has a contrast ratio of 2.9:1, below the minimum 4.5:1 required by WCAG 2.1. Good contrast is essential to ensure all users, including those with low vision or color blindness, can read content easily. You can check contrast ratios using tools like WebAIM Contrast Checker or the WAVE browser plugin.

options.0: Light blue text on dark blue background
options.1: Light gray text on dark gray background
options.3: Medium gray text on dark gray background

2.title: HTML Semantics
2.description: Identify the element that violates accessibility best practices:
2.hint: Native HTML elements are always preferable to custom elements with ARIA.
2.explanation: Using <div> with role='button' is less accessible than a native <button>, as it loses accessibility features and keyboard navigation.

3.title: Web Performance
3.description: Which metric is NOT part of Core Web Vitals?
3.hint: Core Web Vitals focuses on three main aspects: loading, interactivity, and visual stability.
3.explanation: Time to Interactive (TTI) is not part of Core Web Vitals, which are the three main Google metrics for measuring user experience: LCP, FID, and CLS.

4.title: API Testing - Status Code
4.description: Which HTTP status is most appropriate for a successful creation request?
4.hint: Think about the difference between a generic success response (200) and a specific one for creation.
4.explanation: Status 201 Created is most appropriate to indicate that a resource was successfully created in a POST request.

5.title: Accessibility - ARIA Labels
5.description: Identify the incorrect use of ARIA:
5.hint: Avoid redundancy in accessibility attributes, especially when native alternatives already exist.
5.explanation: Using aria-label on an image that already has alt is redundant. The alt attribute already provides the necessary description for screen readers.

6.title: Validation Bug
6.description: Which of these fields accepts invalid input?
6.hint: Check if the values make sense in the real world, especially with dates.
6.explanation: The date field accepts a non-existent date (February 31st), demonstrating lack of proper validation.

7.title: Regression Testing
7.description: Which scenario is NOT suitable for regression test automation?
7.hint: Consider which types of tests depend on human creativity and experience.
7.explanation: Exploratory testing is, by definition, manual and based on tester experience, not suitable for automation.

8.title: SEO and Accessibility
8.description: Which HTML structure harms both SEO and accessibility?
8.hint: Semantic HTML is crucial for both SEO and accessibility.
8.explanation: Using <div> for headings instead of semantic elements like <h1> harms document structure for screen readers and search engines.

9.title: Performance - Lighthouse
9.description: Which metric does NOT directly impact the performance score in Lighthouse?
9.hint: Focus on metrics that directly affect user experience.
9.explanation: The number of DOM elements is a secondary metric that, while important, does not directly impact the Lighthouse performance score.

quality.ctaTitle: Every journey begins surrounded by amazing people
quality.ctaDescription: Quality is born from the collective. Come practice your skills in quality, accessibility, automation, and best practices with a passionate community!
